sections.heading: Unicorn Engine
sections.text:
Unicorn is a lightweight, multi-platform, multi-architecture CPU emulator framework, based on
QEMU
.
Unicorn offers some unparalleled features:
Multi-architecture: ARM, ARM64 (ARMv8), M68K, MIPS, PowerPC, RISCV, SPARC, S390X, TriCore and X86 (16, 32, 64-bit)
Clean/simple/lightweight/intuitive architecture-neutral API
Implemented in pure C language, with bindings for Crystal, Clojure, Visual Basic, Perl, Rust, Ruby, Python, Java, .NET, Go, Delphi/Free Pascal, Haskell, Pharo, Lua and Zig.
Native support for Windows & *nix (with Mac OSX, Linux, Android, *BSD & Solaris confirmed)
High performance via Just-In-Time compilation
Support for fine-grained instrumentation at various levels
Thread-safety by design
Distributed under free software license GPLv2
Further information is available at
http://www.unicorn-engine.org

children.heading: License
children.text:
This project is released under the
GPL license
.

children.heading: Compilation & Docs
children.text:
See
docs/COMPILE.md
file for how to compile and install Unicorn.
More documentation is available in
docs/README.md
.

children.heading: Contact
children.text:
Contact us
via mailing list, email or twitter for any questions.

children.heading: Contribute
children.text:
If you want to contribute, please pick up something from our
Github issues
.
We also maintain a list of more challenged problems in
milestones
for our regular release.
Please send pull request to our
dev branch
.
CREDITS.TXT
records important contributors of our project.
